Q_DESC:
To write a menu driven program in which the user has to perform operations in doubly linked list (DELETION).
The MENU is supposeed to look like the below example:
1. Create List
2. Delete node - from beginning
3. Delete node - from end
4. Delete node - from N
5. Display list
0. Exit
The user is supposed to use the exact numberings as shown above.
INPUT:
1 //create list(option 1 in menu)
4 //number of elements in the list
10 //element one
20 //eleement two
30 //element three
40 //element four
5 //display list(option 5 in menu)
2 //delete node begining(option 2 in menu)
5 //display list(option 5 in menu)
3 //delete node last(option 3 in menu)
5 //display list(option 5 in menu)
0 //Exit(option 0 in menu) 
OUTPUT:
DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 20
DATA of 3 node = 30
DATA of 4 node = 40


DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 20
DATA of 2 node = 30
DATA of 3 node = 40


DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 20
DATA of 2 node = 30
TESTCASE_1:
1 4 10 20 30 40 5 2 5 3 5 0
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 10
DATA of 2 node = 20
DATA of 3 node = 30
DATA of 4 node = 40


DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 20
DATA of 2 node = 30
DATA of 3 node = 40


DATA IN THE LIST:
DATA of 1 node = 20
DATA of 2 node = 30
